result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Denzell D Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Denzell D Harris not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Denzell D Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Tyler James Rubenzer in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. Court waived defendant's apperance.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests a resolution date.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Denzell D Harris not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Denzell D Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim notification has not been sent, defense is waiting for discovery to be sent to the defendant in custody. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Denzell D Harris appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Scott Nelson appeared by video for Denzell D Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Triggiano, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
